events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on a busy intersection causing damage to the front bumper and headlights.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report submitted by the policyholder.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle this case and coordinate with the customer for further steps.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and reassured the customer that processing will begin promptly.
Additional documents including police report, repair estimates, and photos of the damaged vehicle were requested from the claimant.
The claimant submitted all requested documents on time, including detailed photos and an official police report.
An investigation has commenced to verify the circumstances surrounding the vehicle collision and assess damage severity.
Investigation findings confirm the insured party was not at fault, and the damage estimates are consistent with the reported accident.
A settlement offer based on repair costs and policy coverage was proposed to the claimant for review and acceptance.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt handling of their case.
The claim was formally approved after customer acceptance of the settlement terms and validation of all claims criteria.
The settlement payment was issued to the insuredâ€™s bank account to cover the vehicle repair expenses.
The claim case was officially closed following payment issuance and confirmation from the insured of repair commencement.
All claim documents and case files were archived in the system for future reference and regulatory compliance.
